Important Updates Regarding COVID-19

Laws and legal resources related to coronavirus.

Stay up to date on the latest legal developments arising from the COVID-19 pandemic, including changes associated with employment law, evictions and foreclosures, business assistance, taxes, family law, criminal proceedings, and personal injury cases. We have also assembled 50-state resources on coronavirus and the law regarding the following topics:

• Coronavirus and Unemployment Benefits

• Eviction, Mortgage, & Foreclosure Relief During COVID-19

• Stay At Home Orders

Featured News

CARES Act Federal Judiciary Funding: Remote Proceedings, Consent, and State Court Needs

Emergency aid and new rules will increase remote federal court hearings during COVID-19, but also raise questions about consent to such proceedings, as well as state court needs.

Read More

Additional Federal Funds Available Soon for Law Firms Impacted by COVID-19

Congress has approved $380 billion in a second round of federal small business monetary aid that will augment the $349 billion previously allocated for loans and loan forgiveness.

Read More

Tech News

Google Extends Free Access to Advanced Teleconferencing Features to September 30th

Google is making certain Google Meet features free until the end of September, allowing all G Suite users to host meetings for up to 250 and save recorded meetings to Google Drive.

Apple and Google Team Up to ‘Contact Trace’ the Coronavirus

Tech rivals Apple and Google are collaborating to build software into smartphones that will allow users to determine if they have been in close proximity to someone with COVID-19.

SCOTUS Will Hear Arguments by Telephone Conference in Several Cases Because of COVID-19

Due to the coronavirus pandemic, the nation’s top court has announced that it will conduct oral arguments via telephone conference for several cases during the month of May.

French Regulator Says Google Must Pay News Sites to Send Them Traffic

Pursuant to recent EU copyright legislation, French authorities have determined that Google must pay to link articles on the country’s news sites, which Google has thus far refused to do.

Google Uses Location Data to Show Which Places Are Complying With Stay-At-Home Orders -- and Which Aren’t

Data from users who have opted in to sharing their location history with Google are helping government officials assess which communities are heeding instructions to shelter in place.

‘Zoombombing’ Is a Federal Offense that Could Result in Imprisonment, Prosecutors Warn

Government officials have issued a warning that the increasingly popular trend of hacking into video conference calls can lead to arrest and criminal charges resulting in fines and jail time.

SEO News

The White House Wants Us to Use Schema for COVID-19 Announcements

The federal government is encouraging private sector businesses and others to incorporate specific structured data tags to make coronavirus information more visible on search engines.

Google Reveals How Search Behavior Has Changed During COVID-19 Pandemic

Search behaviors that have shifted since the coronavirus outbreak include categories such as assembling critical information, adjusting to changes in routines, and care of self and others.

Google’s New Video Builder Will Help Businesses Create Short YouTube Videos

Google has launched a new YouTube Video Builder tool, which will assist businesses in creating short YouTube videos by using a set of predefined layouts and media resources.

How to Leverage Google Discover to Connect With Users: 4 Key Takeaways

Content creators looking to succeed in their use of Google’s personalized content feed should post mobile-friendly content that is relevant to their most engaged users, among other things.

Social Media News

Facebook Templates for Business Posts About COVID-19 Changes

Business users can now take advantage of templates that will allow them to communicate information to their customers such as how to place orders despite a temporary closure.

Twitter Notifies Users That It’s Now Sharing More Data With Advertisers

Twitter has removed most users’ ability to opt out of sharing information with advertisers related to things like ads they’ve seen or interacted with, and their device’s tracking identifier.

YouTube Viewership Is Up, But YouTubers Are Earning Less Money

YouTube traffic has increased by 15% since the COVID-19 outbreak began, but content creators are making less money due to an almost 50% drop in YouTube advertising rates.

Facebook Ads Fails to Reject COVID-19 Misinformation

Facebook’s AI-driven ad screening process failed to identify several fake ads containing false coronavirus information created to test the reliability of the platform’s ad filtering system.

Legal Industry News

A Remote LSAT is Scheduled for May Because of Coronavirus

The Law School Admission Council plans to administer a remotely proctored LSAT examination for students who had registered for March and April tests that were cancelled.

Practical Steps to Keep Your Firm Running in a Pandemic (and Beyond)

Many remote practice solutions that attorneys have increasingly been utilizing because of the COVID-19 outbreak can help them increase their efficiency and effectiveness in the long run.

ABA Board of Governors Backs Limited Practice for Recent Law School Grads as They Await Bar Exam

In light of the likely cancellation of many July bar exams due to COVID-19, the ABA is urging states to permit limited practice with attorney supervision for new law school graduates.

Thinking Lean: Five Steps to a More Efficient Legal Practice

Tips for creating a more cost-effective law firm include choosing a process to fix, assessing stakeholder needs, and mapping the process to identify and eliminate inefficiencies.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

James Sears

DANVERS, MA

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!

Tip of the Month

Get More out of Your Free Justia Lawyer Directory Profile by Making It More Complete!

Including a list of practice areas, short bio, high quality photo, publications, awards, and a link to your website or blog will help you connect with clients and generate more leads. Adding your office location will help you appear in local lawyer directory searches, and listing an updated email address will make it easier for clients to get in touch today!

Internet Stats

Most Popular Mobile Messaging Apps in the U.S. (2019)

Note: The most popular messaging app in the world is WhatsApp.

Messaging apps can help you stay connected and informed during the coronavirus pandemic. Your law firm should be using messaging apps because your clients are using them and they expect to find you there.

Apps are taking over as the most popular way to connect with friends, family, and businesses.

JurisPro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Cardiology Expert Witness Not Allowed to Testify in Wrongful Death Action

The U.S. District Court Southern District of Florida ruled that Plaintiff's Cardiology Expert Witness could not testify on life expectancy in a wrongful death case against a cruise line.

Police Procedures Expert Witness Allowed to Testify on Standards of Care

A Police Procedures Expert Witness could testify on standards of care, but not offer opinions as to whether those standards were breached.

Forensic Engineering Expert Witness Testifies in Slip and Fall Case

Plaintiff's Forensic Engineering Expert Witness was allowed to testify on the acceptable height and color of a curb in a slip and fall case.

Forensic Psychology Expert Witness' Testimony is Relevant for Insanity Plea

The U.S. Appellate Court (9th Circuit) ruled the testimony of a Forensic Psychology Expert Witness was relevant to defendant's insanity defense.

Learn how to research experts here: JurisPro Expert Witness White Paper
